scheme_name: Civil Service Incentive (De-Notified, Nomadic and Semi-nomadic communities )
nodal_department: Department of De-notified, Nomadic and Semi-nomadic Welfare Department
brief_description: The "Civil Service Incentive" by the Department of De-notified, Nomadic, and Semi-Nomadic Welfare, Government of Madhya Pradesh, offers an incentive of ₹20,000 to ₹50,000 for successful candidates from these communities in MPPSC and UPSC civil service exams.
detailed_description: The "Civil service incentive" by the Department of De-notified, Nomadic, and Semi-Nomadic Welfare, Government of Madhya Pradesh, provides an incentive amount ranging from ₹20,000/- to ₹50,000/- to qualified candidates from De-notified, Nomadic, and Semi-Nomadic communities for their success in various levels of civil service examinations conducted by the Madhya Pradesh Public Service Commission (MPPSC) and the Union Public Service Commission (UPSC).
benefits: ₹20,000/- (Madhya Pradesh Public Service Commission) ₹40,000/- (Union Public Service Commission)
₹30,000/- (Madhya Pradesh Public Service Commission) ₹60,000/- (Union Public Service Commission)
₹25,000/- (Madhya Pradesh Public Service Commission) ₹50,000/- (Union Public Service Commission)
eligibility_criteria: The applicant should be from De-notified, Nomadic, or Semi-Nomadic communities. The applicant should have passed one of the following stages of the MPPSC or UPSC Examination: Preliminary Exam, Main Exam, or Interview.
